bibl.title: George Hawkins v. The United States of America. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court for the Districk of Alaska, Division 2

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF ALASKA, SECOND DIVISION.
The United States of America, Plaintiff, -vs- George Allen, George Hawkins and Thomas Dolan, Defendants.
div1.p: Now at thise time, October 14th, 1902, this cause coming on to be heard upon the motion of James E. Fenton and Albert Fink for an order of this Court setting the case of the United States against the above named defendants George Allen and George Hawkins for trial, the plaintiff appearing by Melvin Grigsby, United States District Attorney, and John L. McGinn, Assistant United States District Attorne, for the District of Alaska, Second Division, and the court being fully advised in the premises, and the defendants by their attorneys consenting thereto;
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED that the trial of the said defendants George Allen and George Hawkins be and the same is hereby fixed for the first Monday in September, A.D., 1903.
Done in open Court this 14th day of October, 1902.
"Filed in the office of the Clerk of the U.S.Dist.Court, Alaska, Second Division, at Nome, Alaska, Oct. 14 1902. Geo. V. Borchsenius, Clerk. By H.A.Haagensen, Deputy Clerk."
div1.ab: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA DISTRICT OF ALASKA SECOND DIVISION
div1.p: I, Geo. v. Borchsenius, Clerk of the United States District Court in and for the District of Alaska, Second Division, do hereby certify that I have compared the foregoing with the original indictment, commitment, mandate, order admitting to bail, and order setting the case of the United States vs. George Hawkins and George Allen for trial, and the same is a true, full and correct copy of each of the said originals, with the file marks and endorsements thereon, now on file and of record in my office.
WITNESS my hand and the seal of said Court hereunto affixed this 14th day of October, A.D., 1902.
div1.ab: Clerk U.S.District Court, District of Alaska, Second Division.

By H A Haagensen
Deputy Clerk.
In the United States Circuit Court in and for the District of Washington Northern Division
In the Matter f the application of George Hawkins for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed Nov. 5. 1902 A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. By RM Hopkins Deputy Clerk.
James E Fenton Attorney for Petitioner
